docs.snippet: The American International Corporation yesterday announced the terms on which it has undertaken the financing of sewerage and water works in Uruguay. This is the first contract taken by the new $50,000,000 corporation formed by Frank A. Vanderlip to...
docs.lead_paragraph: The American International Corporation yesterday announced the terms on which it has undertaken the financing of sewerage and water works in Uruguay. This is the first contract taken by the new $50,000,000 corporation formed by Frank A. Vanderlip to promote foreign trade.

headline.main: EXPECTS OTHER CONTRACTS; American International Corporation Explains Uruguayan Work.

docs.snippet: THE annual Spring Book List of three hundred representative Spring publications which THE NEW YORK TIMES REVIEW OF BOOKS offers this morning will be found to present many interesting features. Especially noticeable in the making up of the list was...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE annual Spring Book List of three hundred representative Spring publications which THE NEW YORK TIMES REVIEW OF BOOKS offers this morning will be found to present many interesting features. Especially noticeable in the making up of the list was the increased activity among the publishers and the universal feeling among them of satisfaction with the present outlook in the publishing business and confidence in its promise for the future.

headline.main: THREE HUNDRED LEADING SPRING BOOKS; The Season's Contributions to Literature Indicated by a Carefully Selected List of Representative Publications

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 27. -- An explanation of the failure of members of the International High Commission visiting South American countries with Secretary of the Treasury McAdoo's party, as well as of officers and men of the United States armored...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 27. -- An explanation of the failure of members of the International High Commission visiting South American countries with Secretary of the Treasury McAdoo's party, as well as of officers and men of the United States armored cruiser Tennessee, to go ashore at Callao, Peru, was received in Washington today through several official sources.
docs.abstract: messages from Sec. McAdoo and others explain failure of party to visit Callao

headline.main: EXPLAINS HITCH AT CALLAO.; McAdoo's Message and Other Information Tell of Quarantine.

docs.snippet: Sir Roger Casement's expedition to the coast of Ireland in a German vessel had a distinct effect on war risk insurance rates. The impression was held in London underwriting circles, for a reason not learned here, that a German raider had also slipped...
docs.lead_paragraph: Sir Roger Casement's expedition to the coast of Ireland in a German vessel had a distinct effect on war risk insurance rates. The impression was held in London underwriting circles, for a reason not learned here, that a German raider had also slipped through the English cordon of ships and was at large in the North Atlantic.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 5. -- Paul M. Warburg of the Federal Reserve Board, who, as a member of the International High Commission, went to the Pan-American conference at Buenos Aires in April and who returned to Washington yesterday, is enthusiastic over the...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 5. -- Paul M. Warburg of the Federal Reserve Board, who, as a member of the International High Commission, went to the Pan-American conference at Buenos Aires in April and who returned to Washington yesterday, is enthusiastic over the progress that is apparent in the strengthening of commercial and financial relations between the United States and the South and Central American republics.
docs.abstract: P. M. Warburg says act has helped greatly in strengthening commercial relations between U. S. and South and Central Americas

headline.main: WARBURG SAYS WAR IS UNITING AMERICAS; Member of Reserve Board Returns from Buenos Aires with Glowing View of Future. OUR BANKERS ACTIVE THERE Commercial Relations with Southern Republics Greatly Strengthened by the Currency Act.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: Plans have been completed by A.W. Buel, an engineer, of 15 William Street, for the construction at some point on Long Island or the Connecticut shore, on a line between Sayville and Bridgeport, of the highest tower in the world, to be used by the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Plans have been completed by A.W. Buel, an engineer, of 15 William Street, for the construction at some point on Long Island or the Connecticut shore, on a line between Sayville and Bridgeport, of the highest tower in the world, to be used by the Federal Holdings Company in wireless communication with a tower near Buenos Aires, for which a concession has been obtained
docs.abstract: Most powerful system in world planned to connect N. Y. and Buenos Aires

headline.main: WIRELESS TO UNITE ALL THE AMERICAS; World's Tallest Towers, 1,000 Feet High, in New York and Buenos Aires, First of Plant. TO BE WORKING IN A YEAR Many Governments Give Sanction to Plan for Better Relations and Protection in War.
CAPT. DUQUESNE FOUND WOUNDED; WILL RECOVER; Explorer and Adventurer, Reported Slain by Indians, Survives Fight.

docs.snippet: Speaking at the fourth annual convention of the Association of Reserve City Bankers at Detroit yesterday W.S. Kies, a Vice President of the National City Bank, said that twice the number of branches opened by this institution in South America last...
docs.lead_paragraph: Speaking at the fourth annual convention of the Association of Reserve City Bankers at Detroit yesterday W.S. Kies, a Vice President of the National City Bank, said that twice the number of branches opened by this institution in South America last year would have been established had it been possible to get men to fill the staffs.
docs.abstract: Wireless apparatus installed at headquarters Bldg.

headline.main: BANKS NEED MORE MEN.; W.S. Kies Tells of Difficulty in Getting Staffs for Foreign Branches.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 13. -- Should the attitude of the de facto Government of Mexico force the hand of the United States Government and compel American armed intervention in Mexican affairs, the United States would have the moral support of those...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 13. -- Should the attitude of the de facto Government of Mexico force the hand of the United States Government and compel American armed intervention in Mexican affairs, the United States would have the moral support of those Pan-American nations that participated in the joint appeal made last year to the Carranza and Villa factions to enter a peace conference for the adjustment of their differences.
docs.abstract: unofficial word received that Pan-Amer. countries would give moral support if Carranza forced intervention

headline.main: PRESIDENT BACKED BY PAN-AMERICANS IN MEXICO POLICY; Southern Countries Would Give Moral Support if Carranza Forced Intervention. UNOFFICIAL WORD RECEIVED First Chief Refrains from Renewing Demands for Withdrawal of Troops. SCOTT REPORTS TOMORROW General Will Tell Baker About Conferences -- Oral Agreement as a Political Move. PAN-AMERICAN BACKS WILSON IN MEXICO
